{"step_by_step_thinking": "Maxillary osteotomy is a surgical procedure, and during any surgery, bleeding is a common concern. Acetoacetic acid and lactic acid are not known to have any properties that prevent bleeding. Heparin is an anticoagulant, which means it prevents blood clots, but it does not prevent bleeding. In fact, it could potentially increase bleeding. Tranexamic acid, on the other hand, is a medication often used to reduce bleeding. It works by slowing the breakdown of blood clots, which helps to prevent prolonged bleeding.", "answer_choice": "D. Tranexamic acid"}
